intro: Norysca mysurensis, commonly known as the Mysore norysca, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of evergreen forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually a pale yellow or white color. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts in its native region.
